results.title: Nuclear body
results.brief_description:
A project by Davide Grassi, Nuclear Body is the result of research into one of the diagnostic techniques used in the field of nuclear medicine: radio-isotopic scanning or schintigraphy. This technique allows the evaluation of a body organ’s state by rendering on a computer monitor a digital image of it. An isotope, introduced intravenously into the patient, after reaching the target organ starts to emit gamma rays, which are than detected by a special gamma camera. By following this procedure methodically, the whole artist’s body was “copied” and “pasted” into a virtual dimension. In Nuclear Body, Grassi utilises schintigraphy not simply as a diagnostic technique, but as a means by which to create a virtual double of a body which could be used in digital environments.

The project was realised in partnership with the Oncological Institute of Ljubljana’s Clinic Centre, and was supported by the Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Slovenia and the City of Ljubljana’s Cultural Department. It was premiered in March 1999 at the Ljubljana’s Cultural and Congress Centre Cankarjev dom in the frame of the festival “the Beauty of Extreme II”.

[ text edited from www.cd-cc.si/kultura/grassi/intro.htm ]

results.title: J.P.McGowan
results.creator_credit: Scott Murray, Paul Kallina and Julie Marlow
results.brief_description: Born in Terowrie, South Australia, J.P.McGowan acted in more than 270 films, many of which he directed, including the acclaimed serial The Hazards of Helen. The first Australian actor and director to ever break in to Hollywood, his film work is regarded as some of the most skilful of the period, and exists in the hands of several dedicated collectors across the globe. A pioneer Australian film maker, McGowan has left an important international legacy. This half hour film documenting the Terowrie celebration of his life, and illustrating the little known life and career of J.P.McGowan is a marvellous addition to Australian film culture. There is a large extant collection of McGowan’s work, clips from which will be sourced for inclusion in the film. The filmmakers will be in touch with the major collectorof McGowan’s work in Adelaide; and there may be an opportunity to acquire the best of it for ACMI collections

results.title: Of day of night
results.brief_description: This experimental interactive CD-ROM explores the intersections of narrative, subjectivity and interactivity. A hybrid of cinematic, textual and interactive elements, it finds resonances between dream experience and the unexpected associations inherent in new media forms. A map of sorts. A handful of objects. A problem with dreaming. Found objects and their imagined traces and histories assist a woman who has a problem with dreaming.

results.title: I am a singer
results.brief_description: This award winning interactive CD-Rom weaves a fragmentary narrative about an amnesiac famed for her singing. Exploring notions of performance, autobiography and memory this is an intriguing and compelling story in which the viewer helps to reconstruct the events of a life lived through song.

results.title: The Hitch
results.brief_description:
A driver picks up a hitchhiker on a deserted country road but it seems neither of them knows what lies ahead.

‘The Hitch’ was shot over 6 days in the outer suburbs of Sydney, Australia. Almost all cast and crew donated their time. The budget was approximately $20,000.

results.title: Place urbanity
results.material_description: video, software, platform, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Place-Urbanity immerses the visitor in 15 fully panoramic video recordings of Melbourne’s suburbs.
A pioneering and humorous work by new media artist Jeffrey Shaw, Place-Urbanity immerses the visitor in 15 fully panoramic video recordings of Melbourne’s suburbs. Each suburb is the district of a specific immigrant or ethnic community.
A robotic platform allows the visitor to rotate the projected image within a fully surrounding 9m diameter projection screen while they navigate through virtual space.
While exploring each of the panoramic scenes the visitor is entertained by a member of that community telling a joke. Place-Urbanity is a humorous comment on how different cultures establish their identities within the Australian socio-geographic context.

results.title: Pentimento
results.material_description: video, interactive software, infra red lights and projection
results.brief_description: PENTIMENTO is based on real events which took place in the Blue Mountains on the outskirts of Sydney, during 1999, involving the discovery of an unidentified body. It fictionalizes these events to dramatize some of the key elements surrounding the murder and the sexual violence which formed its backdrop. It presents these events in the form of recollections from the point of view of a father, sister, brother and the crime scene itself.

results.title: Star Wars
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lucasfilm, Ltd., Gary Kurtz and George Lucas
results.brief_description: A Long time ago in a galaxy far far away, George Lucas’s space adventure captured the hearts and imaginations of film lovers of all ages from the moment these words scrolled across the screen. The Empire’s evil Death Star must be destroyed. The heroes, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo and a pair of droids named R2-D2 and C-3PO, as part of the Rebel Alliance, must pit their strength against the might of the Empire and the evil Jedi, Darth Vader. With the help of an old Jedi Knight, Obi-Wan Kenobi, they battle the forces of darkness and triumph. The special effects and famous “Star wars” theme music has ensured that this film takes its place in cinema history. Includes a ten minute interview between George Lucas and Leonard Maltin.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

results.title: Did It Again â€“ Kylie Minogue
results.credit_line: â„— 1997 Mushroom Records Pty. Ltd. (Seaman / Minogue / Anderson)
results.brief_description: For years, Kylie Minogue had been trying to break out of the boxes the press was determined to put her in: the pop star, bad girl, icon. In Did It Again, she confronted and combated each version of herself in a scenario inspired by The Usual Suspects (1995).

constellations_primary.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_primary.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

results.description: For years, Kylie Minogue had been trying to break out of the boxes the press were determined to put her into: Kylie the pop star, Kylie the bad girl, Kyle the icon. In the music video for ‘Did It Again’, she got to confront and combat each version of herself in a scenario inspired by The Usual Suspects. One of her most enduring hits, the video also cemented her status as a boundary-pushing visual artist.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image â†’ Moving Australia â†’ 04. Music Video

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.
